grafify 1.5.0
  • Reference

Plot points on a quantitative X - Y plot & a numeric grouping variable.

Source: R/plot_xy_NumGroup.R
plot_xy_NumGroup.Rd

This function takes a data table, quantitative X and Y variables, and a and plots a graph with using ggplot.

Usage,
plot_xy_NumGroup(
  data,
  xcol,
  ycol,
  NumGroup,
  symsize = 2,
  symthick = 1,
  fontsize = 20,
  s_alpha = 1,
  TextXAngle = 0
)

Arguments

data

a data table object, e.g. data.frame or tibble.

xcol

name of the column with quantitative X variable

ycol

name of the column with quantitative Y variable

NumGroup

a numeric factor for fill aesthetic of data points.

symsize

size of point symbols, default set to 2

symthick

thickness of symbol border, default set to 1

fontsize

parameter of base_size of fonts in theme_classic, default set to size 20.

s_alpha

fractional opacity of symbols, default set to 1 (i.e. maximum opacity & zero transparency)

TextXAngle

orientation of text on X-axis; default 0 degrees. Change to 45 or 90 to remove overlapping text

Value

This function returns a ggplot2 object.

Details

The function uses geom_point with size = 3, which can be changed using the symsize argument. The numerical NumGroup variable is mapped to the fill aesthetic of symbols, which receives the scale_fill_grafify_c default palette. This plot is related to plot_xy_CatGroup which requires a categorical grouping factor. When summary statistics (mean/median) are required, use plot_3d_scatterbar, plot_3d_scatterbox or plot_4d_scatterbox.

Examples

#Basic usage with mtcars data
#The grouping factor gear is numeric 
plot_xy_NumGroup(mtcars, mpg, disp, gear)
